name: The Sebel Surry Hills

reviews.text: The Citygate Sebel is now called the Sebel Surry Hills. I stayed there for two nights in late Febuary. Initial impressions of the hotel were that the refurbished rooms were nice, clean and spacious. I had a room facing the side street and apart from noise from idiots drinking out on the street corner it was quiet. The foxtel in the room only extended to sport, good if you like sport not so good if you don't which unfortunately I don't.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay... service is a bit lacking

reviews.text: I got a good deal as they had just refurbished (two complementary drinks and free breakfast) but I had to drag the coupons and the information of where breakfast is out of the person working on reception. He seemed far more interested in anything else rather than checking me in properly.
reviews.title: Amazing staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also watch what you are charged for room service, they tried to charge me $6.5 for sparkling water when the menu stated it should be $3.5 and also the multiple menus are confusing. There are 3 menus, the bar menu refers to the prices you would pay in the bar as opposed to the All day dining (which is the room service menu) is the prices you pay in your room ($5 more expensive)
reviews.title: Mixed bag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay there again, possibly its quiet a convienant location... I would just want to get another good deal.
reviews.title: Service???

reviews.text: What a great find! Ideally situated to the shops etc. Staff were amazingly helpful, especially Ken the concierge who was able to recommend fantastic things to do and see during our short stay in Sydney. A boat trip over to Watsons Bay and a meal at Doyles is a must. This place is great value for money and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

likes.liked: — clean, fairly quiet, close to transport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sebel Surry Hills Sydney is an excellent choice for travelers wanting walking access (30 to 40 minutes) to Sydney’s Botanical Garden, Government House, Opera House, and water front. It is located a speedy and easy train ride from either domestic or international air terminals and five minute or less walk from the train station. The comfort, elegance, and accommodating staff make the time in a large metropolitan area pleasant.
reviews.title: elegant and convenient

reviews.text: Unfortunately, my stay at the Sebel Surry Hills was nothing short of disappointing.
reviews.title: LOTS of room for improvement

reviews.text: I stayed with a friend, and upon check-in we were informed that we had been allocated a King Size bed. I asked if it was possible for twin beds and was told the beds would be separated that afternoon. Seven hours later the beds still weren't separated and when we called house-keeping about the issue the staff actually laughed at us. We were there two nights and the beds were never separated.... Highly unprofessional. The staff at breakfast on our first morning weren't much better. In fact, they were no where to be seen!
reviews.title: Nice hotel close to Central station in Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is also very much in need of refreshing - the rooms and hall ways look very tired and most certainly could benefit from a fresh coat of paint.
reviews.title: I loved my stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights in a standard double room. It is located 5 minutes from central station & just off Elizabeth street. It is only a few minutes walk downtown.
reviews.title: Lovely place!

likes.disliked: — The decor was a little aged.

reviews.text: The hotel is not decorated quite as modern as many of the hotels in Sydney, but it is clean and welcoming. The bedrooms are spacious & the bed comfortable. The bathroom is clean and has what you need.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Clean Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool is lovely. It was empty the time we spent there so had it to oursleves. It's clean and not too cold! There's a spa pool & a sauna too. The hotel also offers massage for a price too I think. There's a nice sundeck - but it was raining when I was there so didn't get to use it. There's also a small gym.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at the Citigate

reviews.text: The hotel is safe & secure. The staff are friendly. the place is clean & the rooms are comfortable. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Surpassed our Expectations !!
Value and friendly service
reviews.text: I stay at the Citygate Sebel roughly once a month for business, and it's generally a good stay. The rooms have recently been updated - some with beech wood furniture, other's with a more modern and sleek black finish.
I recently had an appointment in Sydney. I booked this Hotel for 4 nights, and I was highly impressed!
reviews.title: Couldnt have been better!

likes.liked: — The very comfy bed with the plasma screen TV.
likes.disliked: — The pool was a bit cold - but the spa and sauna were lovely!

reviews.text: The staff were friendly, courteous and professional and I really appreciated their assistance with all the questions I had for them. I also appreciated the free newspapers every day.
reviews.title: Let down by lacking communication (of all types)

reviews.text: I had an executive room with a "cloud" king sized bed, which was incredibly comfy, and the room was newly refurbished, with modern, muted colours and very clean. I WAS on the 4th floor....yes, that floor that has the pool on it, but I never once smelled any chlorine and I have to say it was very handy to hop out of the pool, put my waffle weave dressing gown on (supplied by the hotel) and wander down to my room!
reviews.title: Decent... If the rate is good

reviews.text: It was in a VERY convenient spot (about 5 mins walk from Central station) and we walked to Chinatown for dinner, to the markets and a host of cafe's and shops in the area.
reviews.title: Good value if you book online

reviews.text: The last night I was there, I had a Thai massage which was absolutely fantastic. The massage ladies were really lovely and they did a great job of getting rid of those sore areas (especially on my back) with professionalism and good humour.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: This property is ideally located opposite the train station and within easy walk of chinatown. Got an upgrade to a balcony room which was quite nice at night. The bed was comfortable, Importantly, on the 8th floor it was quiet at night.
reviews.title: Great location and good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For breakfast the food was reasonably good and the staff I encountered at all levels were professional. (apart from the restaurant manager at breakfast who never tucked his shirt in).
reviews.title: Disappointing.

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights in October on business. Booked through Bookings.com. On arrival told to check with Accor website as they will have the best prices.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, good location
Ok but could do with a makeover
reviews.text: Double room with King bed on the fourth floor, same floor as the pool. Spacious room and nice views over the park.
Check in was efficient and quick. Car parking at the hotel.
reviews.title: hotel stay

reviews.text: Stayed here a total of five nights-paid Au$98 per night having booked three month in advance. Rooms on some of the nights I stayed were going for $338 the week before I travelled. Room was clean and refurbished, no problem checking in at about noon as my flight from Canada arrived in the morning. Easy walking distance from Central Statin where train from airport takes you for $16. Close to downtown Sydney. Cheap internet cafes, 711 and laundromat just around corner. Recommend "Naughty Chef" Vietnamese restaurant for a quick bowl of noodles as an evening meal. Prince Albert pub not far, and off the beaten tourist track to meet locals. I did not use the in hotel bar or restaurant. Buffet breakfast was offered at a check in rate of $19, $10 off which may appeal to some. One beef, the room carpet was clean but the hallways/elevators really needed to be vacumed with a vacumn with a beater bar/brush instead of just a wand type. Pool and hot tub OK, as was sun deck. I was happy with this stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Value but book early for good rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It cost us only AUD 169 for 2 people which included breakfast at 6am which is good for early flights. We are a very fussy 50+ couple and were rapt with this place. A short walk to the Central Railway Stn, plus yummy cheap eatery called Elephant Jump up the hill. The bed was the best ever, so their claim is true. Traffic was noticeable early on, but when we closed the heavy curtains we did not hear anything. Good shower/bathroom and although we chose the basic room it was superb value, heaps of space, and had everything we needed, especially considering hotel prices in Sydney. Where else can you pay such a low price for this standard.
reviews.title: Best value for money ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sebel Surry Hills is reasonably priced and conveniently located, close to some of the major sight-seeing places as well as the public transportation system. Its strategic location is further enhanced by the friendliness of its hotel staff and the cleanliness and comfort of its rooms. Just a word of caution, make sure you opt for the refurbished wing - that gives it a four star hotel feel.
reviews.title: Make sure you get the refurbished wing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: where to I start?
reviews.title: wouldn't waste my time with this hotel again

reviews.text: The rooms were old and smelled.
reviews.title: What a mess of a place! All staff need to communicate more!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel through lastminute for a cheap price of around $130 a night. On check in we were told we'd been upgraded to an executive room, however it looked pretty standard to us. Recently refurbished it was still a little rough round the edges (no toilet roll holder?) and drafty windows.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main problem with the room was it was on the third floor, directly above what must be a bar or function room. Both nights people were stood outside talking and smoking. The smoke could be smelt through the drafty window, and conversations heard, making it hard to get to sleep.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Other than that, it was comfortable with a small bathroom and large TV.
reviews.title: Hotel fine...but the service~!

likes.liked: — Location was fair, hotel fitout was quite good.

reviews.text: Best thing was the location - only a few minutes walk to Central.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel last week for 4 nights and found the whole experience fantastic. The staff were extremely pleasant and totally professional and helpful with any questions we had. We had a Executive room which was spotless. The pool area was really nice to visit after a hard days walking around and we went up to the sundeck most nights to cool down.
reviews.title: Loved the Citigate Sebel

likes.liked: — proximity to the city of Sydney
likes.disliked: — hotel is looking a bit tired

reviews.text: I don’t fully understand the overall customer proposition offered by the Sebel chain and where it sits within the Accor Group. My room at the Sebel Surry Hills was large, with a sofa, coffee table, comfortable bed, fridge, tea/coffee making facilities and safe .... but it was somewhat bare almost even to the point of soulless. A photo is attached, but the room needed some curtains, rather than just blinds, to soften its feel, plus at least one mirror. There was no bath – it had been replaced by a large walk in shower. Overall I think given the room size, it would also have benefitted from having a kitchenette installed (indeed I thought the Sebel brand implied more of an apart-hotel), to lift its functionality one step further and make use of the space.
reviews.title: Unlike other Sebel's, the rooms are not appartment-style

reviews.text: My rate was also very expensive ..... maybe I had just picked a particularly popular weekend for Sydney tourism.
reviews.title: Very nicely redecorated - great young staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quiet (which I had requested), but was at the back of the hotel, without much of a view (photo attached). Elsewhere in the hotel, there was also a sundeck with a view of some of the Surry streets, plus a small fitness centre.
reviews.title: Avoid the Sebel

reviews.text: The staff were helpful and friendly and there were free newspapers in the lobby area. There are only 2 lifts, so sometimes a short wait.
reviews.title: location good, staff not

reviews.text: The location of the Sebel is good for the central station (trains to and from the airport take 10 minutes and cost c. A$16 single) – about 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The location is also reasonable for Crown Street in Surry, with its selection of restaurants. However, the CBD is further away – around 20 to 30 minutes walk, with Circular Quay about a 40 minute walk, although there is a free bus (number 555) from the station which runs during the daytime outside of rush hour. A bus to Bondi also stops close to the hotel. Mid-sized supermarkets are about a 10 to 15 minute walk, with a 24-hour convenience store right next door.
reviews.title: First impressions - Not Good

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sebel Surry Hills for 4 nights at the end of April and had an overall positive experience. I took advantage of a remodeling special and was able to stay here for just $6/night more than a private room at the nearby hostel!
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Average Hotel

reviews.text: Front desk: All staff were helpful, from check-in to check-out.
reviews.title: Make sure you get aq refurbished room

reviews.text: Common features: Lobby had been remodeled with a somewhat austere modern design. Indoor pool and hot tub were pleasant but barely used by hotel patrons. Hot tub water was filled to an oddly low level, leaving too much of my 6'1" body exposed above the water. Breakfast wasn't included in my room special, so I can't comment on it.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: Remodeled with the same austere modern elements found in the lobby. Comfy bed, sofa, coffee table, desk, mini-fridge, and flat-screen TV. TV got about a dozen fuzzy channels--this is cable? Coffee table and desk had not been dusted. Mini-fridge was overstocked, and a bottle fell out simply by opening it. (More on this later.) There were views of the street from my room on the third floor, but I wasn't staying here to see Sydney's skyline, so that didn't bug me. (Some rooms look onto the roof of an adjacent building, which would bug me.)
reviews.title: 3 Star Hotel at a convenient location

likes.disliked: — lobby maintenance & food were below average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drapes: Although the room had been remodeled and had newer furnishings, the drapes were stained and dirty. The fact that they didn't match anything else in the room suggests they had not been replaced as part of the remodel. This was further confirmed when the drape rod fell down while I was closing one of them, forcing me to contact the front desk to get it put back up.
reviews.title: Cheap weekend in Sydney - ends up a bit pricey and stingy

reviews.text: We stayed here recently with our 4 year old, as the hotel had a package on with Easter
reviews.title: Fine Clean and Comfortable

reviews.text: Show Tickets, parking and breakfast included. We paid an extra $20 to upgrade to the Deluxe Room as I found out refurbishment is not complete and this applies to the superior rooms. .Apparently they only have new beds and not new bathrooms and I had
reviews.title: Walking distance to Central station and Crown Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: read the dismal reviews about the bathrooms. The room was fine, new bathroom, curtains are still old and didn't quite reach the end of the tracking, a very small gap. Bathroom was new which was reassuring. Parents of babies/ young children check if your room has a bath when booking, as ours only had a shower. However this wasn't a problem for only one night. Yes you do hear traffic, sirens etc but you have to expect this being next to Elizabeth St. House keeping service was a little slow but I think the hotel was quite busy this particular weekend. Breakfast was ok, they had run out of weetbix. A good location for those relying on public transport. Pool was fine, is 15 metres and indoor. A short walk to Central Station. Would possibly stay again but only if the special was on, would not pay top dollar as I would want to be in a better part of town if I was paying big money.
reviews.title: OK, but restaurant staff need training!

reviews.text: Stayed one night for work last week and its an OK hotel. Chose this as its right around the corner from where I was working and within walking distance to Central Station and the train to the domestic airport.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.text: Stayed on the third floor opposite the Gym. It was a quiet room of a generous size that had recently been refurbished. Good bed (king) and choice of pillows. The bathroom was similarly generous in size. Although recently refurbished, it was a cold featureless room with old dirty curtains and a well-worn sofa. The TV was on the wall opposite the bed, a bit hard to see from anywhere else in the room (i.e. the sofa).
reviews.title: Newly refurbished with some teething problems

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in a deluxe room. The room was quite nice ,large with a sofa. The bathroom was small in comparison with the shower over the bath. Didnt eat at the hotel. Location good if you dont mind being a bit out of the city. Close to train station and the free shuttle bus goes close by. staff were friendly . nothing out of the ordinary but notning to complain about either.
reviews.title: not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights at around 95 AUD a night, which is an absolute bargain given what you get.
reviews.title: Absolute bargain - Not perfect but can't complain at the price

reviews.text: Sure it's not perfect; the paint in the room was tatty in places and the staff give the feel of students doing holiday work.
reviews.title: Great price... amazing place!!!

reviews.text: However, for that price we got a large relatively quiet stylish room, huge double bed, big tv and swimming pool all in a very central location.
reviews.title: Good, without being great

reviews.text: Go to Brisbane and you'll struggle to find a double room in a dirty hostel for less than 80 AUD.
reviews.title: Good Stay but not helpful staff

description: 4.5 star hotel in Surry Hills. 271 guestrooms, with a 15m heated indoor pool, spa, sauna & gymnasium. Along with 2 restaurants and bars and a cafe, including the Townhouse Bar & Restaurant.
